title: Godlovesyou
author: Godlovesyou
content: If someone wants to run bitcoin node! Please what and what is involved like;* What node is convenient for beginners?* What type of Tutorials should one learn from?* what kind of software installation recommended to download and the link?* what's the best network device or PC is convenient for it?Please this information will help many persons who this is their first time to make such attempt, so your contributions is important.

comments.author: Godlovesyou
comments.body: Quote from: ETFbitcoin on March 31, 2023, 10:11:07 AMQuote from: Godlovesyou on March 31, 2023, 01:34:14 AM* What node is convenient for beginners?If you actually mean application/software to run Bitcoin full node, i would say Bitcoin Core. It's most popular application to run Bitcoin full node and has GUI. It means you could get more help of you have difficulty when using Bitcoin Core.Quote from: Godlovesyou on March 31, 2023, 01:34:14 AM* What type of Tutorials should one learn from?I don't know if it's good tutorial for beginner, but you could check https://bitcoin.org/en/full-node and https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Help:Installing_Bitcoin_Core.Quote from: Godlovesyou on March 31, 2023, 01:34:14 AM* what kind of software installation recommended to download and the link?Bitcoin Core website, https://bitcoincore.org/.Quote from: Godlovesyou on March 31, 2023, 01:34:14 AM* what's the best network device or PC is convenient for it?If you really looking for best and convenient, that means you're looking for fast PC (>= 8GB RAM, >= 1TB SSD and >= 4 core CPU) and fast uncapped internet connection.Thank you for this information, if I need any further help when am stuck, will still message you sir.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: Godlovesyou on March 31, 2023, 01:34:14 AM* What node is convenient for beginners?For a beginner who's not tech-savvy, I'd recommend ordering a Raspberry Pi 4 and configuring it with either Umbrel or myNode. It's easy, fast and reliable setup.For a beginner who's either tech-savvy or tech-savvy wannabe, I'd recommend Raspibolt or Raspiblitz. Note that Raspberry Pi 4 is not for very convenient uses, due to 4 core CPU (the minimum). You should also avoid 2 GB RAM model.

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: Quote from: Godlovesyou on March 31, 2023, 01:34:14 AM* What node is convenient for beginners? You can run the node in two Modes, One is Pruned, and another one is a Full Node. If you run your computer 24/7 and have more than 1 TB of Free space, You can run a Full Node, which will slightly help the Bitcoin network. Quote* What type of Tutorials should one learn from? Follow tranthidung's post Above.Quote* what kind of software installation recommended to download and the link? The latest Bitcoin Core 24.0.1 was released. You can download it here https://bitcointalk.org/bitcoin-24.0.1.torrent. It will download a torrent file, and you can download the official Bitcoin Core using any torrent software. Quote* what's the best network device or PC is convenient for it?  If you follow the mentioned thread, You will get all answers. But, From my experience, I would recommend using at least 8GB of Ram and 7-8th Gen Processor with multiple cores and 1TB of HDD (SSD if possible) and a fast internet connection to download the blocks quickly.
